page.title: 01Farm land round Lower Burton
page.content: Like its neighbour to the west, this block is agricultural and thinly populated. There are few new houses, since planning permission is almost impossible to obtain in rural areas. All farms practise mixed agriculture. Hops are grown at Henwood and Bidney. Pedigree Hereford cattle bred nearby at Haven are grazed on Henwood meadows. burton Court, mentioned in the first Doomsday book, is a family home, housing an exhibition of oriental and European costumes and natural history, and open to the public in the summer. Its lands are a soft fruit farm. Henwood, the other large house in the block, is privately occupied but its lands are all let. The block is crossed in the south by the main Leominster/Hay road, a busy one by north Hereford standards but comparatively quiet by most standards.
